item.title: Introducing the Emulsify UI Kit Beta: The Open Source Tool Set for Design Systems
item.description: The Emulsify UI Kit beta is an open source tool set that combines storybook, configuration, and other resources to make it easy to create design systems. It includes a Figma file and an open source code repository, and allows designers and front-end engineers to collaborate closely to create custom design systems for Drupal and other websites.

item.title: An Emulsify Drupal site is up for a Webby! Go vote!
item.description: The Wu Tsai Institute website, built with Emulsify, has been nominated for a Webby Award in the School/University and Best Mobile Visual Design Aesthetic categories! The website was built using Drupal and uses Emulsify for theming. The Webby Awards are determined by a panel of judges and popular vote, so everyone is encouraged to vote for the website on the Webby Awards website.

item.title: Adding a JS library to an Emulsify Component in Drupal
item.description: Adding a JavaScript library to an Emulsify component may seem daunting if you're new to the process, but it's not as complicated as it may seem. In this guide, we'll show you how to add a JavaScript library to an Emulsify component step-by-step, using the Swiper library as an example.

item.title: Introducing the design tokens file format (from Schema 2022)
item.description: The Design Tokens Community Group (DTCG) is defining a standard design tokens file format, which aims to make sharing design tokens between different tools seamless.

item.title: Specbee teaches how Emulsify Twig makes it easy to write BEM CSS class names
item.description: The BEM (Block, Element, Modifier) methodology is a widely used naming convention for CSS classes that is popular because of the ease of use it offers. Find out how Emulsify Twig makes it easy in Drupal.

item.title: Researching the state of Emulsify
item.description: The Emulsify project has grown a lot since it first launched in 2016. We have thousands of people using it across Drupal and WordPress and a vibrant community of contributors. To celebrate, we are working with you, the community, to create a roadmap for Emulsify that will guide us into the future.

item.title: Frontend & Figma Magic, Building a Connected UI Kit for Emulsify
item.description: Website production has always progressed while navigating a broad divide: the line separating visual design and frontend development. Now, through Emulsify harnessing Figmaâ€™s design tokens plugin, design and development teams can enjoy an automated communication connection.

item.title: Get ready to learn all about Emulsify with our fresh blog
item.description: We want to communicate what is going on in the world of design systems, Drupal themes, WordPress themes, design tokens, and Emulsify with you.
